I-SIGNAL-REF.SYSTEM-SIGNAL-REF:

Maximum route distance = 2km

I-SIGNAL-REF.SYSTEM-SIGNAL-REF: A request from the Driver Assistance Domain Controller (DADC) to the Row 1 Passenger Seatbelt Pretensioner Module (SPM), to control the Seat Belt Tension and Retraction. Precrash Pretension supports Active Safety Front / Rear Pre Crash and Haptic Profiles represent preconfigured haptic routines stored inside the SPM to support ADAS Haptic requests. The signal will show the corresponding Logical Value for the duration of the request.

I-SIGNAL-REF.SYSTEM-SIGNAL-REF:
The IMC_OverTemp signal shall be sent by the V850 in all Power Modes except 0. 
The signal is a periodic signal and not event based to ensure that also ECUs who booted up after the signal has been send receive the signal.

The signal indicates the IMC temperature by being set to 3 values : 
 - If the IMC temperature is within a Normal range, the signal is set to NORMAL.
 - If the IMC temperature increases beyond the Normal range and gets into a Warning range, the  
signal is set to WARNING and the IMC notifies that the unit will shut down in 2 minutes.
 - If the IMC temperature increases beyond the Warning range and gets into a Critical range, the  
signal is set to CRITICAL and the IMC notifies that the unit is in the Amnesty period and above the ESD but below the ESD_Amnesty limits.
I-SIGNAL-REF.label: isOMMTempWarn

children.SYSTEM-SIGNAL-REF:

I-SIGNAL-REF.SYSTEM-SIGNAL-REF:
EuCD Signal.
Range: 0 - 16777214 (0-FFFFFEh)
Resolution: 1 KM
FFFFFFh = Invalid Data

                                                                         
NB: Signals greater than 16bits have to be of Signal Type (Bytes) as VSX does not support Unsigned signals >16bits.

The MSB of the signal must be written to the COM layer first (with an offset of zero in wr_bytes() ) and therefore transmitted on the bus first.
Similarly, subscribing modules will receive the MSB of the signal when they call rd_bytes(0).

E.g. wr_bytes(0) = published_signal_MSB;

Subscribed_Signal_MSB = rd_bytes(0);
I-SIGNAL-REF.label: isOdometerMasterValue

I-SIGNAL-REF.SYSTEM-SIGNAL-REF:
EV Range prediction along programmed Navigation route in km.

If EV Range is less than distance of programmed route, this is the distance the vehicle can travel along the route until it is out of energy.

If EV Range is greater than distance of programmed route, this is the distance of route plus any remaining range (based on the average consumption of that programmed route).
I-SIGNAL-REF.label: isIMCRangeOnRoute

I-SIGNAL-REF.SYSTEM-SIGNAL-REF: A request from the Driver Assistance Domain Controller (DADC) to the Row 1 Passenger Seatbelt Pretensioner Module (SPM), to control the Seat Belt Tension and Retraction. Precrash Pretension supports Active Safety Front / Rear Pre Crash and Haptic Profiles represent preconfigured haptic routines stored inside the SPM to support ADAS Haptic requests. The signal will show the corresponding Logical Value for the duration of the request.

I-SIGNAL-REF.SYSTEM-SIGNAL-REF:
The IMC_OverTemp signal shall be sent by the V850 in all Power Modes except 0. 
The signal is a periodic signal and not event based to ensure that also ECUs who booted up after the signal has been send receive the signal.

The signal indicates the IMC temperature by being set to 3 values : 
 - If the IMC temperature is within a Normal range, the signal is set to NORMAL.
 - If the IMC temperature increases beyond the Normal range and gets into a Warning range, the  
signal is set to WARNING and the IMC notifies that the unit will shut down in 2 minutes.
 - If the IMC temperature increases beyond the Warning range and gets into a Critical range, the  
signal is set to CRITICAL and the IMC notifies that the unit is in the Amnesty period and above the ESD but below the ESD_Amnesty limits.
I-SIGNAL-REF.label: isOMMTempWarn

children.SYSTEM-SIGNAL-REF:

I-SIGNAL-REF.label: isTripUnits

I-SIGNAL-REF.SYSTEM-SIGNAL-REF:
EuCD Signal.
Range: 0 - 16777214 (0-FFFFFEh)
Resolution: 1 KM
FFFFFFh = Invalid Data

                                                                         
NB: Signals greater than 16bits have to be of Signal Type (Bytes) as VSX does not support Unsigned signals >16bits.

The MSB of the signal must be written to the COM layer first (with an offset of zero in wr_bytes() ) and therefore transmitted on the bus first.
Similarly, subscribing modules will receive the MSB of the signal when they call rd_bytes(0).

E.g. wr_bytes(0) = published_signal_MSB;

Subscribed_Signal_MSB = rd_bytes(0);
I-SIGNAL-REF.label: isOdometerMasterValue

I-SIGNAL-REF.SYSTEM-SIGNAL-REF:
Trip computer fuelled range function displayed value in kilometres only.
Used by:
1) Navigation function to compare journey length with available fuel and advise if there is
insufficient fuel for the journey.
2) VSC to calculate Combined Range (Fuel+EV).

I-SIGNAL-REF.SYSTEM-SIGNAL-REF:
EV Range prediction along programmed Navigation route in km.

If EV Range is less than distance of programmed route, this is the distance the vehicle can travel along the route until it is out of energy.

If EV Range is greater than distance of programmed route, this is the distance of route plus any remaining range (based on the average consumption of that programmed route).
I-SIGNAL-REF.label: isIMCRangeOnRoute

children.SYSTEM-SIGNAL-REF:
EV Range prediction along programmed Navigation route in km.

If EV Range is less than distance of programmed route, this is the distance the vehicle can travel along the route until it is out of energy.

If EV Range is greater than distance of programmed route, this is the distance of route plus any remaining range (based on the average consumption of that programmed route).
children.label: isIMCRangeOnRoute
